definition: to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
manuscript copy of a book (before the printing press)

sentences.english: The Codex Sinaiticus is the world's oldest surviving bible.
sentences.chinese: 西奈抄本是世界上现存最古老的圣经。

sentences.english: Rafe showed me copies of your articles.
sentences.chinese: 雷夫让我看了你的文章的抄本。

sentences.english: Christianity, in turn, helped spread the codex throughout the Roman Empire.
sentences.chinese: 反过来，基督教也推动了手抄本在罗马帝国内的传播。

sentences.english: This book is now only statue in Japan by the Court for possession of a residual copy library.
sentences.chinese: 此书在日本现在只有尊经阁文库藏的一个残抄本。

sentences.english: I should return to Verus and show him the charred transcript.
sentences.chinese: 我应该返回维洛司处，将烧毁的抄本交给他。

sentences.english: This was published in our first transcriptions of live channelling.
sentences.chinese: 这发表在我们第一本现场通灵的抄本里。

sentences.english: Mayan hieroglyphics in the Dresden Codex.
sentences.chinese: 在德累斯顿抄本玛雅象形文字。

sentences.english: We have a few of them that survived from this period.
sentences.chinese: 那里保存有当时的一些圣经抄本。

sentences.english: He fully oversees the church administration and faithfully transcribes the Bible Overview Message for every Discipleship Training session.
sentences.chinese: 他负责教会的行政事务以及预备门徒培训信息的抄本。

sentences.english: The manuscripts upon which contemporary critical editions are based come, therefore, from copies of copies.
sentences.chinese: 因此，当代几个主要版本所依据的都是抄本的抄本。

sentences.english: The manuscripts upon which contemporary critical editions are based come, therefore, from copies of copies.
sentences.chinese: 因此，当代几个主要版本所依据的都是抄本的抄本。

sentences.english: A Codex of the bible would be pretty big, maybe that thick and that wide.
sentences.chinese: 圣经做成抄本会很厚，也许有这么厚，这么大。

sentences.english: It is mistaken to define the writer of the manuscript entitled Biographies of the History of the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 抄本《明史列传》的撰者被定为徐干学是错误的。

sentences.english: A "witness" is a copy of the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 一本“抄本”就是圣经的复制本。

sentences.english: It is not clear precisely how this law applies to the codex.
sentences.chinese: 至于这条法律对古籍抄本有多大效力就不清楚了。

definition: manuscript copy of a book (before the printing press)
manuscript (of a book etc)/sketch (of a design etc)
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to proofread/to revise one or more editions of a text using an authoritative edition as a source book/to editorially revise a text
